file_content.text: The Senator called and said he was very pleased with your service. He even said he was pleased with me.
I understand you gave the computer chips to Republic security. How could you do that?
Please track down those computer chips as soon as possible. The Senator is waiting for them.
Honorable Jedi--a moment, please. I greet you on behalf of the great and noble Senator Doli-bur Barc.
Pardon me, soldier. On behalf of Senator Doli-bur Barc, I praise you for your service and ask a moment of your time.
I greet you on behalf of the great and noble Senator Doli-bur Barc. I have the honor of being his senior page.
The Senator sent me as his representative, though he'd prefer to be here himself. He loves to walk among his people.
The Senator sounds like a wonderful man.
I'm sure he does.
Oh, he's the most wonderful man I've ever met.
If your Senator wanted to be here, he'd be here.
Give me a break.
Oh, he does. He stopped here on his way to the spaceport last year. He even waved at some of his admirers.
Why should I care?
Today, the Senator sent me to find brave and loyal citizens to help with a security crisis.
It involves his work to restore the Republic to glory by re-establishing our technological superiority.
We should strive for balance, not domination.
Superiority is the wrong goal.
Exactly, and Senator Barc's bold vision is to see the balance returned.
We must have wisdom, not just gadgetry.
Technology can only go so far.
Exactly. Senator Barc has the wisdom and perseverance to lead us all into the future.
Superior research and development is one of the keys to victory.
Technology is good.
That's gotta cost some serious credits.
Sounds expensive.
It will, and we must thank the great Senator for his enormous generosity.
Technological superiority?
Absolutely! Senator Barc believes technology is the key to strengthening our military and re-establishing our healthy economy.
That's all very nice, but what's the crisis?
Get to the point.
I was just getting to that.
Recently, the Senator arranged to acquire a shipment of computer chips--advanced hardware that could create whole new industries for the Republic.
Unfortunately, the shipment was hijacked by the Migrant Merchants' Guild. Now, Republic security is afraid to take on the guild's thugs.
You're looking for outside help?
That's why you're here.
Exactly. The Senator says this issue is really over security's head anyways.
Republic security has a lot on their plate.
I'm sure they're just busy.
The Senator understands that, which is why he wanted me to find someone like you.
The officers at Republic security sound pretty pathetic.
What cowards.
Someone around here needs to take a stand against the Migrant Merchants' Guild. The Senator wants me to find that someone.
Recovering the shipment of chips from the guild would be a great service to Senator Barc and the Republic.
A Jedi Knight must always serve the Republic.
Then it is my duty to help.
The Force guided me to you for a reason.
I'll help you.
The Senator will be ecstatic to learn that a Jedi is assisting.
Serving the Republic is what I do.
Count me in.
Is Senator Barc paying for this?
What's in it for me?
Yes, of course, your fee. In his generosity, the Senator has promised to personally reward anyone who helps.
Sounds simple.
I can tell you're a woman who means what she says. I'm glad I found you.
I can see you're a man of action, perfect for this job. I'm glad I found you.
To find out where the guild has hidden the Senator's shipment, you'll have to speak with Security Captain Denal-zon--he ran the investigation.
Then return the shipment to Senator Barc's office in the Senate tower. I'm sure he'll want to thank you personally.
I can't help. [Refuse quest]
Maybe this does sound like a lot of work, but these computer chips are very valuable. And the Senator--he--you....
Senator Barc sends his best, citizen.
Our business is concluded. Please excuse me.
